newsitem.title: FINLAND: SISU SAYS RENAULT CO-OP MAY BOOST 1997 PROFIT.
newsitem.headline: SISU SAYS RENAULT CO-OP MAY BOOST 1997 PROFIT.

text.p: Finnish truck maker Sisu Oy, merging with Partek Oy , said in a statement on Thursday that co-operation in trucks with French Renault was a good basis for improved profits in 1997.
"The truck business' cooperation with Renault V.I gives a good starting point for the result to improve in 1996," it said, adding trucks accounted for about six percent of net sales.
Sisu said its 1996 profit after financial items fell to 112 million markka from 219 million in 1995.
Sisu said its key markets showed signs of strengthening and that there were good chances for an improved result this year.
The merger with Partek would bring cost savings and synergy benefits, it said.
